meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Mary Folley John Fausz Lucas Peterson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6487.

td.p: Mary Folley, a statistician from Charlotte, North Carolina
John Fausz, a bartender from St. Louis, Missouri
Lucas Peterson, an actor originally from Oak Park, Illinois (whose 1-day cash winnings total $13,900)

tr.td: LIONS & TIGERS & BEARS, OH MY!
CLASSIC AD SLOGANS
A BUNCH OF "S.B."
STARS OF THE OLDEN SCREEN
IN THE DICTIONARY
CITY NICKNAMES

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us polar bears at Svalbard Island in Norway.) Polar bears are well-adapted to the cold; in addition to having hollow fur that traps heat, their skin absorbs a maximum of heat because it\'s this color')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us polar bears at Svalbard Island in Norway.) Polar bears are well-adapted to the cold; in addition to having hollow fur that traps heat, their skin absorbs a maximum of heat because it's this color

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

tr.td: Lucas
John
Mary

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Lucas
John
Mary
LIONS & TIGERS & BEARS, OH MY!
(We had so much fun in that first round with lions & tigers & bears, we thought we'd do it again, but with a twist, oh my!)
WHAT HAPPENED?
"ING"LISH
(Alex: Each correct response will begin with "I-N-G".)
U.S. MEMORIALS
I WROTE THAT BESTSELLER
ANCIENT JERUSALEM
(Alex: Perhaps not as ancient as you might think - 1st C. AD from a model of Jerusalem in the Israel Museum.)

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Lucas
John
Mary
(lock game)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: I can think of three films that would\'ve provided a fairly good choice for you.)
...
(Alex: [To John] That\'s one of the three, but it\'s not the right one.)
...
(Alex: [To Lucas] The other film that I thought of that you might\'ve considered was King and--The King and I.)
JohnWhat is The Sound of Music?
$2,601
MaryWhat is West Side Story?
$3,201
LucasWhat is the Sound of Music?
$7,600
West Side Story')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'The soundtrack for this film based on a play holds the record for the most weeks at No. 1, 54 weeks in 1962 & \'63')

tr.td: BILLBOARD NO. 1 ALBUMS
The soundtrack for this film based on a play holds the record for the most weeks at No. 1, 54 weeks in 1962 & '63
Lucas
John
Mary
2-day champion: $33,900
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
Lucas
John
Mary

27 R
(including 2 DDs),
1 W

14 R,
3 W
(including 1 DD)

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
